abstract: Want to prevent another financial meltdown? Amar Bhidé, a professor at the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts, has a plan. In an op-ed in The New York Times, he called on Washington to guarantee all bank deposits (not just $250,000) and outlaw derivatives trading, among other risky practices.
lead_paragraph: Want to prevent another financial meltdown? Amar Bhidé, a professor at the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts, has a plan. In an op-ed in The New York Times, he called on Washington to guarantee all bank deposits (not just $250,000) and outlaw derivatives trading, among other risky practices. Read more »
